title: Slayer task/Abyssal demons

properties.name: description
properties.value: Abyssal demons can be assigned as a slayer task at level 85 Slayer and level 85 combat by various slayer masters. They are found in the Abyssal Area, the Slayer Tower, and the Catacombs of Kourend.

content:
This article is currently in the middle of an expansion or major revamping.
The information contained within it should not be considered fully accurate and/or complete. You can help by contributing to it.
Abyssal demons
Requirements
Skills 85
Combat level 85
OtherPriest in Peril
Task Amounts
Vannaka60-120 (200-250)
Chaeldar110-170 (200-250)
Konar120-170 (200-250)
Nieve120-185 (200-250)
Duradel130-200 (200-250)
Advanced data
Icon ID4149

Abyssal demons can be assigned as a slayer task at level 85 Slayer and level 85 combat by various slayer masters. They are found in the Abyssal Area, the Slayer Tower, and the Catacombs of Kourend.

Abyssal demons attack with melee, but are capable of teleporting next to their target making safespots impossible. Whenever they teleport the player will stop attacking it thus having Auto Retaliate on is useful. As demons they are weak to demonbane weapons.

With completion of A Kingdom Divided and 90 magic (and Dragon Slayer II for Ironman accounts for a supply of Wrath runes) abyssal demons can be a strong source of prayer experience. By using Master Reanimation on all Ensouled abyssal heads and Demonic Offering on all Abyssal ashes, abyssal demon kills will be worth on average 307 prayer experience - more than double their base slayer experience. Unlike many other tasks with strong prayer experience potential, the optimum prayer experience from abyssal demons can be achieved without leaving the area.

While the Abyssal Sire can be killed in place of abyssal demons, it is only recommended for those seeking the abyssal orphan pet or abyssal bludgeon as kill times are very slow and completing tasks exclusively at the boss would take too long.

Slayer Unlocks[edit | edit source]

Main article: Slayer reward point
Unlock Points cost Notes
Augment my abbies 100 Number of abyssal demons assigned is increased to 200-250.
Bigger and Badder 150 Increase the risk against certain slayer monsters with the chance of a superior version spawning whilst on a slayer task.
Unholy Helmet 1,000 Learn how to combine an Abyssal Demon head with your slayer helm to colour it red.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Abyssal demon 124 150
  • Abyssal Area (alr)
  • Slayer Tower
  • Wilderness Slayer Cave
  • Standard abyssal demons.
Abyssal demon 124 150
  • Catacombs of Kourend
  • Catacombs of Kourend version of abyssal demons.
Greater abyssal demon 342 4,200
  • Abyssal Area (alr)
  • Slayer Tower
  • Catacombs of Kourend
  • Superior slayer monster variant, which has a chance of spawning on an Abyssal Demon's death after purchasing the Bigger and Badder unlock for 150 Slayer reward points from any Slayer master.
Abyssal Sire 350 450
  • Abyssal Nexus
  • Boss variant.
  • For more information on killing the Abyssal Sire, see Abyssal Sire/Strategies.

Location Comparison[edit | edit source]

Location Maplink Amount Multicombat Cannonable Safespottable Notes
Abyssal Area 13 No No No Not viable due to the presence of other aggressive abyssal creatures and distant spawns, apart from Konar quo Maten tasks.
Catacombs of Kourend 13 Yes No No Multi-combat area allows for barraging in primary rooms and AFK in both primary and secondary rooms.
Slayer Tower (1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US]) 14 No No No It is very far to reach without 71 Agility; recommended to use basement instead for slayer purposes.
Slayer Tower (Basement) 14 No No No Task only
Wilderness Slayer Cave 8 Yes Yes No Level 29 Wilderness and task only. Includes chance to drop blighted items and items from Justine's Last Man Standing rewards shop.

[[Abyssal demon]]s can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] at level 85 [[Slayer]] and level 85 [[Combat level|combat]] by various [[slayer masters]]. They are found in the [[Abyssal Area]], the [[Slayer Tower]], and the [[Catacombs of Kourend]].

Abyssal demons attack with [[melee]], but are capable of teleporting next to their target making [[safespot]]s impossible. Whenever they teleport the player will stop attacking it thus having [[Auto Retaliate]] on is useful. As demons they are weak to [[demonbane]] weapons.

With completion of [[A Kingdom Divided]] and 90 magic (and [[Dragon Slayer II]] for Ironman accounts for a supply of [[Wrath Rune|Wrath runes]]) abyssal demons can be a strong source of prayer experience. By using [[Master Reanimation]] on all [[Ensouled abyssal head|Ensouled abyssal heads]] and [[Demonic Offering]] on all [[Abyssal ashes]], abyssal demon kills will be worth on average 307 prayer experience - more than double their base slayer experience. Unlike many other tasks with strong prayer experience potential, the optimum prayer experience from abyssal demons can be achieved without leaving the area.

While the [[Abyssal Sire]] can be killed in place of abyssal demons, it is only recommended for those seeking the [[abyssal orphan]] pet or [[abyssal bludgeon]] as kill times are very slow and completing tasks exclusively at the boss would take too long.
